medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began 2 weeks prior with lower back pain following a flight. The pain persisted despite treatments and became severe enough to hinder work. Five days before presentation, tightness and subtle swelling in both thighs were noted, followed by rapidly worsening bilateral leg swelling and pain over the next 48 hours.
medical_history.family_history: No family history of venous thromboembolism (VTE), stroke, or sudden death.
medical_history.social_history: Denies tobacco or illicit drug use; moderate alcohol consumption.
